content.text:
# Reward, Inyo County, California

|elevation_footnotes    =
|elevation_m            =1178
|elevation_ft           =3865
|footnotes              =
}}
Reward was a mining site in Inyo County, California. It is located on the west side of the Inyo Mountains  north of Lone Pine, at an elevation of 3865 feet (1178 m).
A post office operated at Reward from 1900 to 1906. The town's name originates from a local mining company, Reward Consolidated Mining Co, who operated the gold and silver Eclipse Mine in 1878 at the site.
